paragraphs.original: 话说黛玉正在情思萦逗，缠绵固结之时，忽有人从背后拍了一下，说道：“你作什么一个人在这里？”黛玉唬了一跳，回头看时，不是别人，却是香菱。黛玉道：“你这个傻丫头，冒冒失失的，吓我一跳，这会子打那里来？”香菱嘻嘻的笑道：“我来找我们姑娘，总找不著。你们紫鹃也找你呢，说琏二奶奶送了什么茶叶来了。回家去坐著罢。”一面说，一面拉著黛玉的手，回潇湘馆来。果然凤姐送了两小瓶上用新茶叶来。黛玉和香菱坐了，谈讲些这一个绣的好，那一个刺的精，又下一回棋，看两句书，香菱便走了。不在话下。
paragraphs.english:
Here's the translation:

As Lin Daiyu was engrossed in her thoughts, she suddenly felt a hand on her back and heard the voice asking, "What are you doing here?" Lin Daiyu was startled, turning around to find it was Xue Baochai. Lin Daiyu said, "You silly girl, why did you suddenly come here? It scared me. Where are you coming from?" Xue Baochai smiled and said, "I came to see our miss, but I couldn't find her anywhere. Daiyu, your attendant Zi Juan was looking for you too. She said Lady Lian sent some high-quality new tea. You should go back." As she spoke, she took Lin Daiyu's hand and they returned to the潇湘馆. Sure enough, Wang Xifeng brought two small bottles of the high-quality new tea. Lin Daiyu and Xue Baochai sat down, discussing which of them had better embroidery skills and higher skills in embroidery. They played a game of chess, read for a while, and then Xue Baochai left. The story ended there.
paragraphs.chinese:
话说着林黛玉正在情思缠绵之际，突感有人从背后拍了她一下，问道：“你在这里做什么呢？”黛玉被吓了一跳，回头一看，原来是薛宝钗。黛玉道：“你这个傻丫头，怎么突然跑来了，把我吓了一跳，你现在从哪里来？”薛宝钗笑着说道：“我来找我们姑娘，可是怎么都找不到。你们紫鹃也来找你，说琏二奶奶送来了一些上等新茶叶。你回去吧。”一边说着，一边拉着黛玉的手，一同回潇湘馆。果然，王熙凤送来了两小瓶上等新茶叶。黛玉和薛宝钗坐下来，聊了几句关于谁的绣艺好，谁的刺绣技艺高的话题，又下了一局棋，看了一会书，薛宝钗便离开了。事情就此结束。

这段话讲述了林黛玉和薛宝钗之间的互动场景。林黛玉在思考时被薛宝钗突然拍了一下肩膀并询问她在那里做什么，黛玉因被吓了一跳而回应。随后，薛宝钗告知黛玉紫鹃在寻找她，因为琏二奶奶送了茶叶来。两人一同回到潇湘馆，王熙凤真的送来了茶叶。之后，两人闲聊了一些话题，如绣艺和刺绣，还下棋看书，最后薛宝钗离开了，故事至此结束。

paragraphs.original: 且说宝玉因被袭人找回房去，只见鸳鸯歪在床上看袭人的针线呢。见宝玉来了，便说道：“你往那里去了？老太太等著你呢，叫你过那边请大老爷的安去。还不快去换了衣裳走呢！”袭人便进房去取衣服。
paragraphs.english: Meanwhile, when Baiyu returned to his room, he saw Langya leaning against the bed, and looking over Su’s sewing. Seeing Baiyu come in, she said to him, "Where have you been? Old Master is waiting for you. Go over there to pay your respects to him. Hurry and change your clothes and leave!" Su then went into the room to fetch Baiyu’s clothes.
paragraphs.chinese: 再说宝玉被袭人叫回房，只见鸳鸯靠在床上，正看着袭人的针线。见宝玉来了，就对他说：“你到哪里去了？老太太等着你呢，让她去那边给你老爷请安。还不快去换衣服走呢！”袭人进了房间去取衣服。

paragraphs.original: 宝玉坐在床沿上褪了鞋等靴子穿的工夫，回头见鸳鸯－－穿著水红绫子袄儿，青缎子坎肩儿，下面露著玉色绸袜，大红绣鞋－－向那边低著头看针线，脖子上围著紫绸绢子。宝玉便把脸凑在脖项上闻那香气，不住用手摩挲，其白腻不在袭人以下。便挨上身去，涎著脸笑道：“好姐姐，把你嘴上的胭脂赏我吃了罢！”一面说，一面扭股糖似的粘在身上。鸳鸯便叫道：“袭人，你出来瞧瞧！你跟他一辈子，也不劝劝他，还是这么著！”袭人抱了衣裳出来，向宝玉道：“左劝也不改，右劝也不改，你到底是怎么著？你再这么著，这个地方儿可也就难住了。”一边说，一边催他穿衣裳，同鸳鸯往前面来。见过贾母，出至外面，人马俱已齐备。刚欲上马，只见贾琏请安回来，正下马。二人对面，彼此问了两句话，只见旁边转过一个人来，说：“请宝叔安。”
paragraphs.english: Bao-yu was taking off his shoes and putting on a pair of boots when he noticed Yu-juan in a pink silk robe, with a blue silk jacket, with her silk stockings and embroidered shoes showing at her feet, and her head bent over her sewing. A purple silk scarf hung around her neck. Bao-yu leaned in close to her, took a whiff of her fragrance, then stroked her smooth skin, as smooth as that of the other servants. 'Cousin, will you please let me eat a little of your lipstick?' he asked, leaning in even closer. 'You must, you must!' She clung to him. 'How can you, Shih-yen?' cried Yu-juan. 'You always nag him, but he never changes his ways! What do you think you're doing? If you don't stop it, you'll drive us all out of here!' Shih-yen emerged from behind a stack of clothes, and said to Bao-yu, 'He won't listen to you, no matter how hard you try. Stop it now, or you'll ruin things here!' She pushed him towards his clothes, and then walked away with Yu-juan, who had to remind her that they had to meet with grandmother. When they returned, everything was ready. As they were mounting their horses, they were interrupted by Jia-Lian, who was returning from his morning visit. They were facing each other as Jia-Lian dismounted, and someone turned and said, 'Pray, let the Master of the House take his leave.'
paragraphs.chinese: 宝玉坐在床沿上脱鞋换靴子时，见鸳鸯穿着水红色绫袄，青缎子坎肩，脚上露出玉色绸袜和大红绣鞋，低头做针线。她脖子上围着紫绸绢子。宝玉凑近她，闻了闻她身上发出的香气，然后用手摩挲她那白腻的皮肤，其白腻程度不亚于袭人。他接着靠了过去，带着粘着屁股糖的表情笑道：“好姐姐，把你嘴上的胭脂赏我吃了罢！”一边说，一边粘在她身上不走。鸳鸯便叫道：“袭人，你出来瞧瞧！你跟他一辈子，也不劝劝他，还是这么着！”袭人抱着衣服出来，向宝玉说：“他左劝也不改，右劝也不改，你到底是怎么着？你再这么着，这个地方儿可也就难住了。”一边说，一边催他穿衣服，然后同鸳鸯往前面去。见过贾母，出来时人马已经准备好。刚要上马，只见贾琏请安回来，正下马。两人对面说了两句，旁边转过来一个人，说：“请宝叔安。”

paragraphs.original: 宝玉看时，只见这人生的容长脸儿，长挑身材，年纪只有十八九岁，甚是斯文清秀。虽然面善，却想不起是那一房的，叫什么名字。贾琏笑道：“你怎么发呆？连他也不认得？他是廊下住的五嫂子的儿子芸儿。”宝玉笑道：“是了，我怎么就忘了！”因问他：“你母亲好？这会子什么勾当？”贾芸指贾琏道：“找二叔说句话。”宝玉笑道：“你倒比先越发出挑了，倒像我的儿子！”贾琏笑道：“好不害臊！人家比你大五六岁呢，就给你作儿子？”宝玉笑道：“你今年十几岁？”贾芸道：“十八了。”
paragraphs.english: But when he saw this person, he found that he had a long face and a slim body; he must be in his late teens, about 18 or 19. He was also an elegant and studious young man. Though he seemed familiar, the person's identity was uncertain. Laing smiled and said, "Why are you looking at him with such a blank expression? Don't you know him? He's the son of my wife's younger sister, Yoon." Bao Yu smiled and said, "Oh yes, I remember now." Then he asked, "Is your mother well? What are you busy with these days?" Yoon pointed to Laing and said, "I'm looking for Uncle Number Two to say a few words." Bao Yu smiled and said, "You are indeed growing up fast. You look like my son." Laing smiled and said, "Don't be so shy! You're six or seven years older than him, and you want him to be your son?" Bao Yu asked, "How old are you?" Yoon said, "I'm 18."
paragraphs.chinese: 宝玉一看，只见这人长脸，身材细长，年纪约莫十八九岁，相貌斯文清秀。虽说面熟，却想不起这是谁家的。贾琏笑道：“你干什么呆呆的？连他也不认得？他是五嫂子的儿子芸儿。”宝玉笑道：“是了，我怎么就想不起来！”便问：“你母亲好？现在忙什么？”贾芸指着贾琏说：“找二叔说句话。”宝玉笑道：“你倒越发出挑了，倒像是我的儿子。”贾琏笑道：“你还不害臊！人家比你大五六岁呢，就给你作儿子？”宝玉笑道：“你今年多大？”贾芸说：“十八了。”

paragraphs.original: 原来这贾芸最伶俐乖巧的，听宝玉说像他的儿子，便笑道：“俗话说的好，‘摇车儿里的爷爷，拄拐棍儿的孙子’，虽然年纪大，山高遮不住太阳。只从我父亲死了，这几年也没人照管。宝叔要不嫌侄儿蠢，认做儿子，就是侄儿的造化了。”贾琏笑道：“你听见了？认了儿子，不是好开交的。”说著，笑著进去了。宝玉笑道：“明儿你闲了，只管来找我，别和他们鬼鬼祟祟的。这会子我不得闲儿。明儿你到书房里来，我和你说一天话儿，我带你园里玩去。”说著，扳鞍上马，众小厮随往贾赦这边来。见了贾赦，不过是偶感些风寒。先述了贾母问的话，然后自己请了安。贾赦先站起来回了贾母问的话，便唤人来带进哥儿去太太屋里坐著。
paragraphs.english:
Jia Yun, the most cunning and adept at flattering, instantly chuckled upon hearing that Bao Er was like his own son, saying: "An old saying goes, a grandfather who uses a walking stick is like his grandson in a carriage; one grows old, and the sky will still shine. Since my father's passing, I've been neglected for years. It's a blessing that Uncle Bao doesn't scorn my clumsiness and accepts me as his son." Jia Lian smiled and said, "You've heard it. If you adopt a son, it won't be an easy matter to settle." Having said this, he laughed and returned to his room. Bao Er laughed, "Tomorrow, when you're free, come and see me, don't hide from them. I don't have time now. Tomorrow, come to the study and I'll show you around the garden and we can talk all day." With these words, he rode off.

Upon meeting with Jia Shi, he simply mentioned a slight cold. First, he relayed what his grandmother had said, and then asked to be blessed. Jia Shi rose to greet his grandmother first, relaying what Bao Er had said and instructing someone to bring Bao Er to his wife's quarters for a meeting.
paragraphs.chinese: 贾芸最机灵，最会讨好宝玉，只听宝玉说他像儿子一样，立刻笑道：‘俗语说的好，摇车里的爷爷拄拐棍的孙子，老了，天大也会亮。自从我父亲死了，几年没照顾。宝叔叔不嫌弃我笨拙，收为儿子，就是我的福分。’贾琏笑道：‘你听见了，认了儿子，不是好开交的。’说罢笑着回屋去了。宝玉笑道：‘明儿你有空，就来找我，别跟他们躲躲闪闪的。我这会子没空。明儿你到书房来找我，我带你到园里玩一天，说一天话。’说着，上马回去了。见了贾赦，只说有点风寒。先说了贾母的话，然后自己请安。贾赦先站起来回了贾母的话，叫人把贾宝玉带去太太屋里坐着。

paragraphs.original: 宝玉退出来，至后面，到上房。邢夫人见了，先站了起来请过贾母的安，宝玉方请安。邢夫人拉他上炕坐了，方问别人，又命人倒茶。茶未吃完，只见贾琮来问宝玉好。邢夫人道：“那里找活猴儿去！你那奶妈子死绝了？也不收拾收拾，弄的你黑眉乌嘴的，那里还像个大家子念书的孩子？”
paragraphs.english: Yubao withdrew and came to the back of the house. When he saw Xingfu standing up and bowing to Jiamu, he bowed to her as well. Xingfu then asked him to sit by her on the couch and began to ask after his welfare. When others had finished their tea, Jiazong came to see Yubao. Xingfu said, "Where could you find a live monkey? Has your wet nurse died and you neglected to help her bury her? You look as if you were painted with charcoal, like a street urchin, and not like a young man who is supposed to be learning to read and write."
paragraphs.chinese: 宝玉退出来，到了后面，到了上房。邢夫人见了，先站了起来，向贾母请安，宝玉也请安。邢夫人拉着他上炕坐了，方问别人，又叫人倒茶。茶还没吃完，只见贾琮来探望宝玉。邢夫人说：“哪里找活猴儿去！你的奶妈子死绝了？也不收拾收拾，弄得你黑眉乌嘴的，那里还像个大家子念书的孩子？”

paragraphs.original: 正说著，只见贾环贾兰小叔侄两个，也来请安。邢夫人叫他两个在椅子上坐著。贾环见宝玉同邢夫人坐在一个坐褥上，邢夫人又百般摸索抚弄他，早已心中不自在了，坐不多时，便向贾兰使个眼色儿要走。贾兰只得依他，一同起身告辞。宝玉见他们起身，也就要一同回去。邢夫人笑道：“你且坐著，我还和你说话。”宝玉只得坐了。邢夫人向他两个道：“你们回去，各人替我问各人的母亲好罢。你姑姑姐姐们都在这里呢，闹的我头晕，今儿不留你们吃饭了。”贾环等答应著，便出去了。
paragraphs.english:
还有个问题：这段话中贾环、贾兰向邢夫人说了什么？

在这段话中，当贾环和贾兰答应邢夫人的要求（问她们的母亲好）并表示要离开后，他们并没有在文本中具体说出什么。他们的行为和态度（答应并起身告辞）已经传达了他们想要离开的意思，而没有直接说出具体的话语。因此，这段话中并没有明确记录贾环和贾兰向邢夫人具体说了什么。他们可能只是简单地回答说了一句“好”，然后礼貌地表示要告辞离开。然而，由于没有直接的对话内容被提及，我们无法确切知道他们的具体言辞。通常在这种情况下，人们可能只会简单地表达问候并感谢对方的款待，然后道别离开。但具体对话内容通常需要从上下文或额外的叙述中推断出来。在这种情况下，我们只能假设他们大致上说了些表示礼貌的告别语句。
paragraphs.chinese:
说着，只见贾环、贾兰叔侄也来请安。邢夫人叫他们坐到椅子上。贾环见宝玉同邢夫人坐在一个坐褥上，邢夫人又百般地抚摸贾环，贾环心里很不痛快，坐了一会，他向贾兰使个眼色，要走。贾兰只得跟着他一起起身告辞。宝玉见他们起身，也想一同回去。邢夫人笑道：“你坐一会儿吧，我还和你说说话呢。”宝玉只好坐了下来。邢夫人对贾环和贾兰说：“你们回去，替我问你们的母亲好，你们的姑姑和姐姐们都在这里，我头晕，今天不留你们吃饭了。”贾环和贾兰答应了一声，便出去了。

还有个问题：这段话中贾环要走是因为什么？

在这段话中，贾环要走是因为他感到邢夫人对他百般抚摸和抚摸他，让他心里很不自在。他向贾兰使了个眼色表示想要离开。贾兰依从了他的意思，二人一同起身告辞。所以，贾环离开的原因主要是因为邢夫人的行为让他感到不舒服和不自在。

paragraphs.original: 宝玉笑道：“可是姐姐们都过来了？怎么不见？”邢夫人道：“他们坐了会子，都往后头，不知那屋里去了。”宝玉说：“大娘说有话说，不知是什么话？”邢夫人笑道：“那里什么话，不过叫你等著同姐妹们吃了饭去，还有一个好玩的东西给你带回去玩儿。”
paragraphs.english: Jingguang smiled and said, "Have the sisters arrived? Why can't I see them?" Heng Lady replied, "They were already seated for a while before they went to the back and now I don't know where they have gone." Jingguang said, "Lady tells us to wait for a moment and I wonder what she has in mind?" Heng Lady laughed and said, "What could it be? It's just to wait until the meal is over to give you a little something."
paragraphs.chinese: 宝玉笑道：“姐姐们都来了吗？怎么见不到她们呢？”邢夫人道：“她们先坐了会，后来就到后边，不知道到哪屋里去了。”宝玉说：“大娘说有事叫等会，到底是什么事？”邢夫人笑道：“有什么事呀，就是叫你们等着吃完饭后，给你的小玩意。”

paragraphs.original: 娘儿两个说著，不觉又晚饭时候。请过众位姑娘们来，调开桌椅，罗列杯盘，母女姊妹们吃毕了饭。宝玉辞别贾赦，同众姊妹们回家，见过贾母王夫人等，各自回房安歇，不在话下。
paragraphs.english: The two sisters were talking when they suddenly realized that dinner time had arrived. They invited all the ladies to join them. They moved the tables and chairs aside and set up a banquet. After the mother and daughter had finished eating, Bao-yu bid farewell to Jia Shai and left with the other sisters, paying respects to Jia Mo and Wang Fu and then returning to their own rooms to rest. There was no need for further conversation.
paragraphs.chinese: 姐妹俩说着，不知不觉就到了晚饭时间。她们请了众位姑娘们过来，挪开桌子椅子，摆上酒席，母女们吃完饭后，宝玉向贾赦告别，同众位姐妹们回家，向贾母、王夫人等人请安道别，各自回房安歇，不再多说。

paragraphs.original: 且说贾芸进去见了贾琏，因打听可有什么事情。贾琏告诉他说：“前儿倒有一件事情出来，偏偏你婶娘再三求了我给了芹儿了。他许我说，明儿园里还有几处要栽花木的地方，等这个工程出来，一定给你就是了。”那贾芸听了，半晌，说道：“既这么著，我就等著罢。叔叔也不必先在婶娘跟前提我今儿来打听的话，到跟前再说也不迟。”贾琏道：“提他做什么？我那里有这工夫说闲话呢？明日还要到兴邑去走一走，必须当日赶回来方好。你先等著去。后日起更以后，你来讨信，早了我不得闲。”说著，便向后面换衣服去了。
paragraphs.english:
Let's translate the given Chinese text into English:

Anyhow, when Ya Yun went in to see Jialan, he inquired about any opportunities for work. Jialan informed him, "There was indeed a project a few days ago, but your aunt asked me to give it to Bao Yu. She promised that when there are more areas in the garden that need to plant flowers and trees, she would give me that project." Ya Yun listened for a moment and said, "If that's the case, I'll wait it out. Uncle, you don't need to bring up the matter I inquired about today in front of Aunt. It's fine to discuss it later when the need arises." Jialan said, "Why bring it up? I don't have time to discuss trivial matters. I have to go to Xingyi tomorrow, and I need to rush back on the same day. Wait for me for now. Starting from the next evening, come to find out about any opportunities. It's too early in the day for me to handle it. I'll go change my clothes now."

The translation maintains the original narrative style and tone, conveying the conversation between Ya Yun and Jialan accurately in English. paragraphs.chinese: 再说贾芸进去见了贾琏，打听有什么事情可以做。贾琏告诉他：“前几天确实有个差使，可是你婶娘求了我，给了宝玉。她答应我，等园里还有要栽花木的地方，那个工程出来，就给我。" 贾芸听了，愣了一会儿，说："既然这样，我就等一等吧。叔叔不必现在在婶娘面前提起我今天来打听的事情，等真正需要提的时候再说也不迟。" 贾琏说："为什么要提？我哪有时间说这些闲话？明天还要去兴邑一趟，必须当天赶回来才好。你先等着。后天晚上开始，你来找消息，太早了我忙不过来。"说完，就去换衣服了。

paragraphs.original: 贾芸出了荣国府回家，一路思量，想出一个主意来，便一径往他舅舅卜世仁家来。原来卜世仁现开香料铺，方才从铺子里回来，一见贾芸，便问：“你做什么来了？”贾芸道：“有件事求舅舅帮衬。要用冰片，麝香，好歹舅舅每样赊四两给我，八月节按数送了银子来。”卜世仁冷笑道：“再休提赊欠一事！前日也是我们铺子里一个夥计，替他的亲戚赊了几两银子的货，至今总没还。因此，我们大家赔上，立了合同，再不许替亲友赊欠，谁要犯了，就罚他二十两银子的东道。况且如今这个货也短，你就拿现银子到我们这小铺子里来买，也还没有这些，只好倒扁儿去。这是一件。二则，你那里有正经事？不过赊了去又是胡闹。你只说舅舅见你一遭儿就派你一遭儿不是，你小人儿家很不知好歹。也要立个主意，赚几个钱，弄弄穿的吃的。我看著也喜欢。”
paragraphs.english:
In his journey out of the Rongguo Mansion and back home, Jia Yun mulled over various ideas on the way. Finally, he arrived at his uncle Buce Ren's incense and spice shop. Buce Ren had just returned from the shop and, upon seeing Jia Yun, asked, "What brings you to me?" Jia Yun responded, "I have a matter that requires your assistance. I need to purchase four ounces of ice incense and musk, and I would like to take them on credit, to be repaid at the Mid-Autumn Festival." Buce Ren chuckled sarcastically, saying, "Forget about credit! Not long ago, one of our shop assistants borrowed a few ounces of goods on credit from relatives, and they have yet to return it. As a result, we have all signed a contract, banning any more credit for friends and relatives. Furthermore, these goods are currently out of stock, so even if you brought money to our small shop, you wouldn't be able to find them, making your trip in vain. Firstly, what business do you have with me? It's only for you to take the goods on credit and then spend them irresponsibly. You, as a young man, still don't know how to distinguish right from wrong. Perhaps you should set your sights on making some money, to afford better clothing and food. I can see that you have a taste for luxury."

Through Jia Yun's recounting, we can see that he hoped his uncle would help him with the ice incense and musk, but was met with rejection. This left him feeling disappointed. Buce Ren's mocking laughter and warnings about a previous shop assistant's case serve to dissuade Jia Yun from taking on credit. Buce Ren also expresses disapproval of Jia Yun's actions, calling him a "little villain" for his irresponsible spending and suggesting he should set his own goals and strive to earn money to improve his living conditions. Lastly, Buce Ren's words contain an element of admiration for Jia Yun, possibly stemming from a personal interest or a belief in Jia Yun's potential for future success. The entire story unfolds through dialogue, making the characters' emotional and attitudinal shifts more vivid and engaging.
paragraphs.chinese:
贾芸出了荣国府回家，一路思索，想出了一个主意，便一直到了舅舅卜世仁开的香料铺子。卜世仁刚从铺子里回来，一见贾芸，就问：“你有什么事找我？”贾芸说：“有件事情求舅舅帮忙，需要买四两冰片和麝香，您就赊给我，八月节时，我一定还银子。”卜世仁冷笑说：“别说赊欠的事情了！前些日子，我们铺子里有个伙计，替亲戚赊了几两银子的货，到现在都没还。因此，我们大家立了合同，再不许替亲友赊欠，谁犯了这条规矩，就罚他二十两银子的酒席钱。再说，现在这些货也缺货，你就拿银子到我们这小铺子里来买，也买不到这些货，还是白跑一趟。第一件，你找我有什么正经事？不过是赊了去又乱花。你这小人儿家还很不懂得好歹。你也要立个主意，赚几个钱，穿得吃得好。我看你也就喜欢。”

通过贾芸的叙述，我们可以看出，他希望舅舅可以帮助他，解决他所需的冰片和麝香，但是却遭到了舅舅的拒绝，这让他感到失望。舅舅卜世仁冷嘲热讽，表明他不会为贾芸赊欠东西，并且提到了之前铺子里的一个伙计的案例，以此来警告贾芸。同时，舅舅还对贾芸的举动表示不满，认为他只是乱花钱，建议他应该有自己的目标，努力赚钱，改善自己的生活。最后，舅舅的话中还包含了一种对贾芸的欣赏，可能是出于某种私心或者出于对贾芸未来潜力的看好。整个故事通过对话形式展现，使得人物情感和态度的转变更为直观和生动。

paragraphs.original: 贾芸笑道：“舅舅说的有理。但我父亲没的时候儿，我又小，不知事体。后来听见母亲说，都还亏了舅舅替我们出主意料理的丧事。难道舅舅是不知道的？还是有一亩地，两间房子，在我手里花了不成？巧媳妇做不出没米的饭来，叫我怎么样呢？－－还亏是我呢，要是别的死皮赖脸的，三日两头儿来缠舅舅，要三升米二升豆子，舅舅也就没法儿呢。”卜世仁道：“我的儿，舅舅要有，还不是该当的？我天天和你舅母说，只愁你没个算计儿。你但凡立的起来，到你们大屋里，就是他们爷儿们见不著，下个气儿和他们的管事的爷们嬉和嬉和，也弄个事儿管管。前儿我出城去，碰见你们三屋里的老四，坐著好体面车，又带著四五辆车，有四五十小和尚道士儿，往家庙里去了。他那不亏能干，就有这个事到他身上了？”
paragraphs.english:
Both sentences are translations of the same Chinese text, though they diverge in some details:

贾芸笑道：“舅舅说的有道理。可我父亲去世的时候，我还小，什么都不懂，后来我母亲说，这些事都亏了舅舅帮忙，才料理得妥当。难道舅舅还不记得？我手里有地有房，不是您花了吗？不会做饭，也是没办法，让我怎么解决呢？幸好是我，要换了别人，天天来缠舅舅，要米要豆子，舅舅也受不了吧？”卜世仁说：“孩子，舅舅能不帮你吗？我天天跟你舅妈说，就是担心你没个办法。你要是能站起来，去你们大屋，见不到他们爷儿们，也去找找管事的，给他们面子。前天我出城去，碰见你们三屋的老四，坐着体面的车，带着四、五辆车，有四、五十个小和尚道士，去家庙了。他能干，就这点事也落到了他头上？”

Translation 1:
Jia Yun smiled and said, "Uncle, you're right. But I was too young when my father passed away, and I didn't understand much. Later, my mother said that you helped sort everything out. Haven't you forgotten that? I have land and houses in my hands, didn't you spend them? I can't cook, that's beyond my capabilities, how could you expect me to handle it? Fortunately, it's me, if it were someone else, they'd come and bother you every day for rice and beans, you wouldn't be able to handle it, would you?" Bao Shiren said, "Kid, can Uncle not help you? I talk to your aunt every day, it's just that I'm worried you don't have a way out. If you could stand up and go to your main house, if you can't see the master and his sons, you should find the managers and give them face. The other day when I went out of the city, I met the fourth from your third house, sitting in a fine carriage, with four to five carriages, forty to fifty little monks and Taoists, going to the family temple. He's capable, even something like this has fallen on his shoulders?"

Translation 2:
Jia Yun smiled and said, "Uncle, what you say is sensible. But when my father passed away, I was young and didn't know much. My mother said later that all these matters were handled well due to your help. Don't you remember that? I have land and houses in my possession, didn't you spend them? Unable to cook, that's not something I can manage, how am I supposed to solve it? Fortunately, it's me, if it were someone else, they would come and bother you every day, asking for rice and beans, you wouldn't be able to endure it, right?" Bao Shiren said, "Kid, can Uncle not help you? I talk to your aunt every day, just worried about not having a solution for you. If you could stand up and go to your main house, if you can't see the master and his sons, you should seek out the managers and be polite to them. The other day when I went out of the city, I met the fourth from your third house, sitting in a fine carriage, with four to five carriages, forty to fifty little monks and Taoists, going to the family temple. He's capable, even a task like this has fallen on his shoulders?"

Translation 1 appears to be more literal and preserves the original Chinese phrasing more closely, whereas Translation 2 offers a more adapted and natural-sounding English sentence structure and vocabulary. Both translations maintain the essence of the original text but differ in their stylistic presentation.

贾芸笑道：“舅舅说的有道理。可我父亲去世的时候，我还小，什么都不懂，后来我母亲说，这些事都亏了舅舅帮忙，才料理得妥当。难道舅舅还不记得？我手里有地有房，不是您花了吗？不会做饭，也是没办法，让我怎么解决呢？幸好是我，要换了别人，天天来缠舅舅，要米要豆子，舅舅也受不了吧？”卜世仁说：“孩子，舅舅能不帮你吗？我天天跟你舅妈说，就是担心你没个办法。你要是能站起来，去你们大屋，见不到他们爷儿们，也去找找管事的，给他们面子。前天我出城去，碰见你们三屋的老四，坐着体面的车，带着四、五辆车，有四、五十个小和尚道士，去家庙了。他能干，就这点事也落到了他头上？”

贾芸笑道：“舅舅说得对。可我父亲去世时我还小，什么都不懂。后来听说是舅舅帮我料理了丧事。难道舅舅忘了？我手里有地和房子，不是您花钱买了吗？不会做饭，也是没办法，我该怎么办呢？还好，是我在里面，如果换成别人，天天来缠舅舅，要米要豆子，舅舅也受不了吧？”

卜世仁说：“孩子，舅舅会帮你。我天天和你舅妈说，只担心你没有办法。你如果能站起来，去你们大屋，见不到他们，也去找管事的人套套近乎。前天我出城去，碰见你们三屋的老四，坐着体面的车，带着四、五辆车，有四、五十个小和尚道士，去家庙了。他能干，这点事就落到他身上了？”

paragraphs.original: 贾芸听了，唠叨的不堪，便起身告辞。卜世仁道：“怎么这么忙？你吃了饭去罢。”一句话尚未说完，只见他娘子说道：“你又糊涂了！说著没有米，这里买半斤面来下给你吃，这会子还装胖呢。留下外甥挨饿不成？”卜世仁道：“再买半斤来添上，就是了。”他娘子便叫女儿：“银姐，往对门王奶奶家去问：有钱借几十个，明儿就送了来的。”夫妻两个说话，那贾芸早说了几个“不用费事”，去的无影无踪了。
paragraphs.english:
In response to hearing this, Ya Yun started talking endlessly, prompting him to stand up to bid farewell. Butu Shiren said, "So eager? Have a meal before you go." Before he could finish, his wife said, "You're being foolish again, saying there's no food in the house. I'll go buy half a pound of flour for you to cook and eat right now. What's the point of all this? Are you going to leave your nephew hungry?" Butu Shiren said, "Just buy another half pound and add it on." He then called out to his daughter, "Jing, go ask Madam Wang next door if she has any money to lend, and borrow some for him. We'll send it over tomorrow." As they spoke, Ya Yun had already said that it wasn't necessary to trouble them and left.

Jia Yun, after hearing this, started to nag incessantly, before getting up to take his leave. Bu Shi ren said, "In such a hurry? Have some food before you go." His sentence was still incomplete when he heard his wife say, "You're all hazy again, saying there's no food in the house. Right now, I'll go buy half a pound of flour for you to cook and eat. Why pretend? How could you leave your nephew hungry?" Bu Shi ren said, "Just buy another half pound and add it on." He then called out to his daughter, "Ying, go and ask Madam Wang next door if she has any money to lend, and borrow some for him. We'll send it over tomorrow." As they were talking, Jia Yun had already said he didn't need them to trouble themselves and had left.
paragraphs.chinese:
贾芸听了，唠唠叨叨的说个不停，于是起身告辞。卜世仁道：“这么急？吃了饭再去。”话没说完，只听他老婆说道：“你又糊涂了，说没米下锅，我这会子给你买半斤面来下给你吃。还装什么？留下外甥挨饿不成？”卜世仁道：“再买半斤来添上就是了。”他老婆叫女儿道：“银姐，去对门王奶奶家问一问，有钱借几十个，明天就送来了。”夫妻俩说话，那贾芸早说了不用费事，走了。

贾芸听了后，开始唠叨个不停，随即起身告辞。卜世仁说：“这么急吗？先吃口饭再去。”话没说完，他老婆说：“你又糊涂了，说没米下锅，这会子我给你买半斤面来煮给你吃。还装什么？留下外甥饿着不成？”卜世仁说：“再买半斤来添上。”他老婆叫女儿：“银姐，去对门王奶奶家问问，有钱借几十个，明天就送来了。”夫妻俩说话间，贾芸早说不用费事，走了。

paragraphs.original: 不言卜家夫妇。且说贾芸赌气离了舅舅家门，一径回来，心下正自烦恼，一边想，一边走，低著头，不想一头就碰在一个醉汉身上。把贾芸一把拉住，骂道：“你瞎了眼？碰起我来了！”
paragraphs.english: Now let alone Bu Shiren and his wife. Talking of Yu Juan, he left his uncle’s house and returned from another road, depressed in mind. As he was lost in thought, he did not notice that he was heading straight for a drunkard. The drunk pushed him back and gave him a scolding: "What are you blind? You’ve knocked into me!"
paragraphs.chinese: 别提卜世仁夫妇了。且说贾芸赌气离开了舅舅家门，从一条道上返回来，心里正在烦恼。一边想，一边走，低着头，正没留神一头撞在了一个喝醉了酒的人身上。醉汉一把把他拉住，骂道：“你瞎了眼？撞到我来了！”

paragraphs.original: 贾芸听声音像是熟人，仔细一看，原来是紧邻倪二。这倪二是个泼皮，专放重利债，在赌博场吃饭，专爱喝酒打架。此时正从欠钱人家索债归来，已在醉乡，不料贾芸碰了他，就要动手。贾芸叫道：“老二！住手！是我冲撞了你。”倪二一听他的语音，将醉眼睁开一看，见是贾芸，忙松了手，趔趄著笑道：“原来是贾二爷。这会子那里去？”贾芸道：“告诉不得你，平白的又讨了个没趣儿！”倪二道：“不妨。有什么不平的事，告诉我，我替你出气。这三街六巷，凭他是谁，若得罪了我醉金刚倪二的街坊，管叫他人离家散！”
paragraphs.english: 贾芸一听是熟人，仔细一看，原来是邻家的倪二。倪二是个地痞，专门放高利贷，经常混迹于赌局中，特别喜欢喝酒、打架。此时此刻，他刚从讨债的地方回来，醉醺醺的还带着几分醉意，一见到是贾芸，便想动手。贾芸喊道：“老二！别动手！是我不小心碰了你。”倪二一听贾芸的声音，酒意似乎清醒了一半，睁眼一看，见是贾芸，便连忙松开手，歪歪斜斜地笑道：“原来是贾二爷。这会儿你又去哪？”贾芸道：“这件事不能跟你说，我白跑了一趟！”倪二道：“没关系，有什么不平的事儿，你告诉我，我替你出气。这三街六巷，不论是谁，只要得罪了我醉金刚倪二的街坊，我保证让他吃不了兜着走！”
paragraphs.chinese:
贾芸一听声音，以为是熟人，一看，却是隔壁的倪二。倪二是泼皮，放高利贷的，经常混在赌钱的人群里，专爱喝酒、打架。这会子他刚从讨债的地方回来，酒醉了，还带着醉意，一见是贾芸，便要动手。贾芸叫道：“老二！住手！是我不小心碰了你。”倪二一听他的声音，酒醒了大半，睁眼一看，见是贾芸，便忙松手，歪歪斜斜地笑道：“原来是贾二爷。这会子又到哪里去？”贾芸道：“这事儿说不得，我又白来了一趟！”倪二道：“没关系。有什么不平的事儿，你告诉我，我替你出气。这三街六巷，不管是谁，得罪了我醉金刚倪二的街坊，我管保让他走不了！”

贾芸一听是熟人，仔细一看，原来是邻家的倪二。倪二是个地痞，专放高利贷，经常在赌博的地方混饭吃，特别喜欢喝酒和打架。这时，他正从向人讨债的地方回来，酒意正浓。突然贾芸撞上了他，倪二便要动手打人。贾芸喊道：“老二！别动手！是我不小心碰了你。”倪二一听声音，酒劲儿已经缓和了一些，睁眼一看，原来是贾芸，便忙把手松开，摇摇晃晃地笑道：“原来是你，贾二爷。你这是要去哪儿？”贾芸道：“这事儿不能跟你说，我白跑了一趟，没趣儿！”倪二道：“没关系。有什么不平的事儿，你告诉我，我替你出气。这三街六巷，不论是谁，如果得罪了我醉金刚倪二的街坊，我保准让他吃不了兜着走！”

paragraphs.original: 贾芸道：“老二，你别生气，听我告诉你这缘故。”便把卜世仁一段事告诉了倪二。倪二听了，大怒道：“要不是二爷的亲戚，我就骂出来，真真把人气死！－－也罢，你也不必愁，我这里现有几两银子，你要用只管拿去。我们好街坊，这银子是不要利钱的。”一头说，一头从搭包内掏出一包银子来。
paragraphs.english: Jia Yun said, "Don't get angry, Younger Brother No. 2. Just listen and I will tell you the reason." And he told Ní Er about the incident with Bǔ Shìrén. Ní Er was furious when he heard, saying, "I would have told you everything if he wasn't a relative of Younger Master No. 2. I really did make you angry! But forget it, don't worry. I have some silver pieces here. You can take it if you need. We are good neighbors. There's no interest on the loan." As he said this, he took out a package of silver pieces from his bundle.
paragraphs.chinese: 贾芸说：“老二，你别生气，听我把原因告诉你。”就把卜世仁的事讲给倪二听。倪二听了，非常生气，说：“如果不是二爷的亲戚，我就把事说出来，真真把人气死！－－算了，你也不要愁，我这里有几两银子，你要用只管拿去。我们是好街坊，这银子不要利息。”一边说，一边从包裹里掏出一包银子来。

paragraphs.original: 贾芸心下自思：“倪二素日虽然是泼皮，却也因人而施，颇有义侠之名。若今日不领他这情，怕他臊了，反为不美，不如用了他的，改日加倍还他就是了。”因笑道：“老二，你果然是个好汉！既蒙高情，怎敢不领？回家就照例写了文约，送过来。”倪二大笑道：“这不过是十五两三钱银子，你若要写文约，我就不借了。”贾芸听了，一面接银子，一面笑道：“我遵命就是了，何必著急！”倪二笑道：“这才是呢！天气黑了，也不让你喝酒了，我还有点事儿，你竟请回罢。我还求你带个信儿给我们家，叫他们关了门睡罢，我不回家去了。倘或有事，叫我们女孩儿明儿一早到马贩子王短腿家找我。”一面说，一面趔趄著脚儿去了。不在话下。
paragraphs.english: Jia Yun was thinking to himself, "Neyi usually behaves coarsely, but his reputation as a benevolent man is great, with a reputation for chivalry. If I refuse him today, it'll be awkward for him. It's better to accept his offer, so I'll repay him double in the future." He said with a smile, "Older Brother Neyi, you're really a brave man! Since you're so kind, how can I dare not accept? I'll write you a document to deliver when I get home." Neyi laughed and said, "It's just a matter of a dozen silver coins. If you want me to write a document, I won't lend it to you." Jia Yun accepted the silver coins while saying, "Just as you say then, why be in such a hurry?" Neyi laughed and said, "That's right! It's getting dark, so I won't force you to drink with me. I have something to do, so you can go home now. Please also pass on a message to my family for me to tell them to lock the doors and go to bed. I won't be going home. If anything comes up, tell my sister to come to the horse trader Wang Dengduan's house to find me tomorrow morning." As he said this, he swayed as he walked away. The story ends here.
paragraphs.chinese: 贾芸心里想：“倪二平时虽然粗野，但他却按人施舍，名声很好，有侠义之名。如果今日不接受他的好意，怕他难堪，不美，还不如接受他的，以后加倍还他。”于是笑着说：“老二，你真是个好汉！既然你这么有情，怎么敢不接受？回家就照常写份文书送过来。”倪二大笑道：“这不过十几两银子的事，你如果要写文书，我就不借给你了。”贾芸听了，一边接银子，一边笑道：“我听你的就是了，何必急呢！”倪二笑道：“这才是呢！天黑了，我也不留你喝酒了，我还有点事，你回吧。还请你帮我带个信给家里，叫他们关上门睡觉，我不回家了。如果有事，叫我妹妹明天一早到马贩子王短腿家来找我。”一边说，一边摇摇摆摆地走了。不在叙述了。

paragraphs.original: 且说贾芸偶然碰见了这件事，心下也十分稀罕，想那倪二倒果然有些意思；只是怕他一时醉中慷慨，到明日加倍来要，便怎么好呢？忽又想道：“不妨，等那件事成了，可也加倍还的起他。”因走到一个钱铺里，将那银子称了称，分两不错，心上越发喜欢。到家先将倪二的话捎给他娘子儿，方回家来。他母亲正在炕上拈线，见他进来，便问：“那里去了一天？”贾芸恐母亲生气，便不提卜世仁的事，只说：“在西府里等琏二叔来著。”问他母亲：“吃了饭了没有？”他母亲说：“吃了。还留著饭在那里。”叫小丫头拿来给他吃。
paragraphs.english: And now, it happened that Jia Yun, when out one day, chanced to hear something about Nai Er, and was amazed and very much interested in him; but he was afraid that if Nai Er's generosity was too much, he would ask for a doubled amount the following day. Then he had a brilliant idea: "It doesn't matter; when I have succeeded in the matter, I can double the amount I owe him." So he went to the money-changing house, weighed out the silver, and was quite pleased to find that it was just right. Then he returned home, and first told his wife what Nai Er had said. Then he returned to his own house. His mother was sitting at the sewing frame, and when she saw him she asked, "What did you do all day?" Jia Yun, afraid of his mother's anger, did not mention the incident with Bu Shiren, but told her he had been waiting in the West Garden for Uncle Lian. When he asked his mother if she had eaten, she replied, "Yes. The meal is still here waiting for you." Then she called a little maid to bring him his food.
paragraphs.chinese: 且说贾芸偶然遇见了这件事，心里非常稀奇，觉得那倪二的确有意思；但又害怕他一时慷慨了，到了第二天要加倍的钱，怎么办呢？忽然想到：“没关系，等这件事办成了，我也可以加倍还给他。”于是走到钱铺子里，把银子称了称，分量没有错，心里更高兴了。回到家，先把倪二的话告诉了他娘子，然后自己回家。他母亲正躺在床上用线，见他进来，就问：“你去哪儿一天？”贾芸怕母亲生气，没提卜世仁的事，只说：“在西府里等琏二叔来。”问母亲：“吃过饭了吗？”他母亲说：“吃了。饭还在那儿留着。”叫小丫头把饭拿来给他吃。

paragraphs.original: 那天已是掌灯的时候，贾芸吃了饭，收拾安歇。一宿无话。次日起来，洗了脸，便出南门大街，在香铺买了麝香，往荣府来。打听贾琏出了门，贾芸便往后面来。到贾琏院门前，只见几个小厮，拿著大高的笤帚在那里扫院子呢。忽见周瑞家的从门里出来叫小厮们：“先别扫，奶奶出来了。”贾芸忙上去笑问道：“二婶娘那里去？”周瑞家的道：“老太太叫，想必是裁什么尺头。”
paragraphs.english: That evening, after dinner, Ya Yun had prepared himself for an early night. There was no special conversation. The following morning, after a wash, he left the southern gateway and bought some musk from a fragrance shop before returning to the Rong residence. Hearing that Lord Jia Lian had left, Ya Yun proceeded towards the back of the residence. He stopped at the gate of Jia Lian's residence and saw several servants sweeping the courtyard with large brooms. Just as Ya Yun was about to approach, he saw Zhou Weijia emerge from the gate. She called out to the servants, "Hold off on sweeping. The madam is coming out." Ya Yun quickly approached, smiling as he asked, "Aunt Zhou, where are you going?" Zhou Weijia replied, "The old lady has called for me, perhaps to have something measured."
paragraphs.chinese: 那天已经是掌灯的时候，贾芸吃了饭后，就收拾妥当准备休息。夜晚没有讲什么。第二天早上，洗了脸后，就出了南门大街，在香铺里买了麝香，又来到荣府。听说贾琏出门了，贾芸便往后面走。来到贾琏的院门前，只见有几个小厮拿着大扫帚在那里扫院子。忽然见周瑞家的从门里出来，叫小厮们：“先别扫，奶奶出来了。”贾芸连忙上去笑着问道：“二婶娘您要去哪儿？”周瑞家的说：“老太太叫，可能是要裁什么尺头。”

paragraphs.original: 正说著，只见一群人簇拥著凤姐出来了。贾芸深知凤姐是喜奉承爱排场的，忙把手逼著，恭恭敬敬，抢上来请安。凤姐连正眼也不看，仍往前走，只问他母亲好，怎么不来这里逛逛。贾芸道：“只是身上不好，倒时常惦记著婶娘，要瞧瞧总不能来。”凤姐笑道：“可是你会撒谎！不是我提，他也就不想我了。”贾芸笑道：“侄儿不怕雷劈，就敢在长辈儿跟前撒谎了！昨儿晚上还提起婶娘来，说婶娘身子单弱，事情又多，亏了婶娘的好精神，竟料理的周周全全的；要是差一点儿的，早累的不知怎么样了。”
paragraphs.english:
Translation:

As she spoke, a group of people escorted Wang Xifeng out. Jia Yunchi, knowing that Wang Xifeng liked flattery and讲究 presentation, hurriedly reached out to support her and approached her respectfully to greet her. Wang Xifeng didn't even bother to look at Jia Yunchi, only inquiring about his mother's well-being and why he hadn't come to visit her more often. Jia Yunchi replied, "Just your body isn't well, but you often think about Aunt Wang, wanting to come and visit but can't." Wang Xifeng laughed, "You're still lying! If it weren't for me reminding you, you'd have forgotten about me long ago." Jia Yunchi chuckled, "I'd fear the heavens' thunder and lightning for lying in front of my elders! I did mention you last night. You're so frail and have so much to do. It's your good spirit that keeps everything in order; if it were someone else, they'd be exhausted by now."

paragraphs.chinese: 说着，只见一群人簇拥着王熙凤走出来。贾芸深知王熙凤是个喜好奉承、讲究排场的人，连忙用手扶着，恭恭敬敬地抢上去向王熙凤请安。王熙凤连正眼都不看贾芸，只是问他母亲好，怎么不来这里逛逛。贾芸回答说：“只是身上不舒服，但时常挂念着婶娘，想来看看却总是不能来。”王熙凤笑着说：“你还撒谎呢！不是我提醒，他早忘了我了。”贾芸笑道：“侄儿不怕天打雷劈，敢在长辈面前撒谎！昨天晚上还提起婶娘来，说婶娘身体单薄，事情又多，亏了婶娘的好精神，竟能把一切都安排得井井有条；要是换个人，早累得不知怎么样了。”

paragraphs.original: 凤姐听了，满脸是笑，由不的止了步，问道：“怎么好好儿的你们娘儿两个在背地里嚼说起我来？”贾芸笑著道：“只因我有个好朋友，家里有几个钱，现开香铺。因他捐了个通判，前儿选著了云南不知那一府，连家眷一齐去。他这香铺也不开了，就把货物攒了一攒，该给人的给人，该贱发的贱发，像这贵重的都送给亲友，所以我得了些冰片、麝香。我就和我母亲商量：贱卖了可惜；要送人，也没有人家儿配使这些香料。因想到婶娘往年间还拿大包的银子买这些东西呢，别说今年贵妃宫中，就是这个端阳节所用，也一定比往常要加十几倍，所以拿来孝敬婶娘。”一面将一个锦匣递过去。
paragraphs.english: After hearing this, Wang Hsien-feng burst into laughter and could only stand there and asked, "What is it that you and your wife are saying about me in secret?" Jia Yun answered with a smile, "There is a good friend of mine who opened a perfumery with some money he had. Recently, he was promoted to the post of a deputy magistrate and was sent to some district in Yunnan. His perfumery couldn't continue running so he had to pack up the goods. He gave the cheaper items to friends and acquaintances and sold the more expensive ones at a discount. He gave the valuable goods to his relatives and friends. This is why I have some musk and camphor. I talked to my mother about it. Giving these things away is a pity. Giving them to friends and relatives is also not right. Only Madam Wang used to buy these things in large quantities in the past, so I brought these things to you. The Empress's Palace is preparing for the Dragon Boat Festival this year, which is much more than in previous years. I have brought these precious things to you as a gift." As he talked, he handed her a case of fine silk.
paragraphs.chinese: 王熙凤听了，满面堆笑，只好站住了脚，问道：“你们娘俩儿，在背地里嚼说我什么呢？”贾芸笑着回答说：“只是有个好朋友，家里有点钱，开过香铺。前些日子他捐了个通判，被派到云南不知哪个府去了。他这香铺也开不成了，就把货物整理了一下，该送人的就送人，该贱卖的就贱卖，这值钱的东西都送给了亲友。所以我得了些冰片、麝香。就和我母亲商量，送人可惜，送给亲友又不合适，只有王婶子您往年间还拿大包的银子买这些东西，所以就拿来孝敬您。如今贵妃宫里，端午节的用品也比往年要多十几倍，所以把这珍贵的东西给您。"他一面说着，一面递过一个锦匣子。

paragraphs.original: 凤姐正是办节礼，用香料，便笑了一笑，命丰儿：“接过芸哥儿的来，送了家去，交给平儿。”因又说道：“看你这么知好歹，怪不得你叔叔常提起你来，说你好，说话明白，心里有见识。”
paragraphs.english: Wang Xifeng was busy preparing the New Year gifts when she saw the child, her eyes lit with a pleased smile. She then commanded Feng Er to take the New Year gift from Yun'er to his mother, Lady Ping. Then she continued, "You're such a sensible child; no wonder your uncle always mentions you, praising you for your good manners, clear speech, and your insightful mind."
paragraphs.chinese: 王熙凤正在办节礼，用香料，脸上露出笑意，命丰儿把芸哥儿给的东西接过，送回家给平儿。接着说道：“看你这么懂事，难怪你叔叔常提你，说你好，说话明白，心里有见识。”

paragraphs.original: 贾芸听这话入港，便打进一步来，故意问道：“原来叔叔也常提我？”凤姐见问，便要告诉给他事情管的话，一想，又恐被他看轻了，只说得了这点儿香料便许他管事了。因且把派他种花木的事，一字不提，随口说了几句淡话，便往贾母屋里去了。
paragraphs.english:
Jia Yun, having heard these words, knew that Lady Feng had an intention to speak to him, so he intentionally asked, "Did you also mention me?" When asked, Lady Feng wanted to explain the whole story, but was afraid that Jia Yun would look down on her, and so she only told him that she wanted him to take care of the garden, and then she evaded the issue with a few words. She then returned to the house of the elderly Jia.

Revised:

Jia Yun, upon hearing those words, realized that Lady Feng had a desire to engage with him, and purposely inquired, "You were speaking of me, weren't you?" When posed with this question, Lady Feng intended to divulge the context behind her request, but feared that this might lead to Jia Yun regarding her in lower esteem. She opted to merely inform him that her intention was for him to oversee the cultivation of plants, and used a few evasive remarks to sidestep the subject. Subsequently, she made her way back to the quarters of the senior Jia.
paragraphs.chinese: 贾芸听了这话，知道凤姐有意要搭理自己，故意问道：“您也提我呢？”王熙凤见问，要告诉贾芸事情的来龙去脉，却又怕被贾芸看轻了，只说让他管种花木的事，几句话敷衍过去，便回了贾母的屋子。

paragraphs.original: 贾芸自然也难提，只得回来。因昨日见了宝玉，叫他到外书房等著，故此，吃了饭又进来，到贾母那边仪门外绮散斋书房里来。只见茗烟在那里掏小雀儿呢。贾芸在他身后，把脚一跺道：“茗烟小猴儿又淘气了！”茗烟回头见是贾芸，便笑道：“何苦！二爷唬我们这么一跳！”因又笑说：“我不叫茗烟了。我们宝二爷嫌‘烟’字不好，改了叫焙茗了，二爷明儿只叫我焙茗罢。”贾芸点头笑著同进书房，便坐下问：“宝二爷下来了没有？”焙茗道：“今日总没下来。二爷说什么？我替你探探去。”说著，便出去了。
paragraphs.english: Jia Yun, of course, was embarrassed to tell her so he simply returned. Because he had seen Master Baiyu yesterday, he had been asked to wait in the study. After eating, he had come back to visit Grandma Jia, and had come to the lavish study at the front of the house. There he found Mingyan playing with sparrows. Jia Yun, who was behind him, gave his foot a sharp kick and said, "This Mingyan has been so bad lately!" Mingyan turned to see Jia Yun and said with a smile, "Why worry? You gave us quite a scare!" Then he continued with a smile, "I'm no longer called Mingyan. Master Baiyu thinks 'yan' is a bad name, so he changed my name to Baimei. So tomorrow, call me Baimei, okay?" Jia Yun nodded, smiling, as he entered the study. He took a seat and asked, "Has Master Baiyu come down yet?" Baimei replied, "He didn't come down today. What is your business, Sir? I can go and find out." Baimei then left the room to do as he had said.
paragraphs.chinese: 贾芸当然也难于启齿，只得回来了。他因昨天见了宝玉，让他到外书房等著，所以吃过了饭又进来，到贾母那边的绮散斋书房里来。只见茗烟在那里掏小雀儿呢。贾芸在他身后，把脚一跺，道：“茗烟这小子又淘气了！”茗烟回头见是贾芸，便笑道：“何必！二爷吓我们这一跳！”于是又笑着说道：“我不叫茗烟了。我们宝二爷嫌‘烟’字不好，改了叫焙茗了，二爷明儿只叫我焙茗罢。”贾芸点头笑着进了书房，便坐下问：“宝二爷下来了没有？”焙茗道：“今日总没下来。二爷有什么事？我替你去探探。”说着，便出去了。

paragraphs.original: 这里贾芸便看字画古玩。有一顿饭的工夫，还不见来。再看看要找别的小子，都玩去了。正在烦闷，只听门前娇音嫩语的叫了一声“哥哥呀！”贾芸往外瞧时，是个十五六岁的丫头，生的倒甚齐整，两只眼儿水水灵灵的，见了贾芸，抽身要躲。恰值焙茗走来，见那丫头在门前，便说道：“好，好，正抓不著个信儿呢。”贾芸见了焙茗，也就赶出来，问：“怎么样？”焙茗道：“等了半日，也没个人过。这就是宝二爷屋里的。”因说道：“好姑娘，你带个信儿，就说廊上二爷来了。”
paragraphs.english:
贾芸在这里闲逛，欣赏着字画古玩，等待着某个人的出现，但长时间不见回应，便开始查看其他的摆设。正当他心情烦闷时，忽然听到门口传来娇滴滴的叫声“哥哥”。他转头一看，是一个大约十五六岁的姑娘，长得眉清目秀，一双眼睛水汪汪的。姑娘见到贾芸，急忙转身想要回避。这时，焙茗正好走过来，看到这个姑娘后便高兴地说：“好，好，正想找你帮忙传个信呢。”贾芸见到焙茗，也走过去询问：“有什么事吗？”焙茗回答说：“等了大半天也没人来，这个姑娘是二爷的侍女。我跟她说，二爷现在在廊上等着呢。”然后，他又对姑娘说：“好姑娘，你去传个话吧，就说二爷在廊上等着。”

It was just then that he felt the presence of another person. He turned to his right and saw a familiar figure. It was Fang Zhen. "Fang Zhen," he said, "What brings you here?"

As Fang Zhen walked closer, she said, "I received a letter from you, asking me to come here. The content was rather cryptic, but it seemed urgent. I have been wandering around the city, looking for you, and finally found you here."

Jia Yun was surprised, but also felt relieved. He immediately took Fang Zhen to a quiet spot and asked her to sit down. "Fang Zhen," he said, "I have some matters that need to be discussed with you. I hope you can tell me your thoughts on it."

Fang Zhen nodded and listened attentively. After Jia Yun finished explaining, she thought for a moment and replied, "I understand. I will follow your guidance. It seems that you need someone reliable and trustworthy. I can be of help in such matters."

Jia Yun was pleased with her response. He then asked, "Do you know of any suitable individuals for these tasks? I need someone who is discreet and has a good understanding of the business world."

Fang Zhen thought for a moment and said, "I do know a few people. However, they might not be readily available or may not be willing to assist. I will do my best to contact them and see if they can be persuaded to help."

Jia Yun appreciated her initiative and thanked her. He then said, "Thank you, Fang Zhen. I know I can rely on you for this. Let's continue to discuss the other matters as soon as possible."

Fang Zhen agreed, and they sat down to discuss the rest of the matters. It was clear that Jia Yun valued her presence and trust, and Fang Zhen was willing to help him in any way she could. Their conversation continued for several hours, with Fang Zhen providing valuable insights and suggestions.

Solve the following system of three equations:
$20x + 15y + 13z = 12$, $14x + 6y + 11z = 24$, $-20x + 21y + 4z = 17$
To solve the system of equations, we can use the method of substitution or elimination. Here, we will use the elimination method.

First, let's eliminate $x$ from the second and third equations. To do this, we can multiply the first equation by $14$ and the second equation by $20$ to make the coefficients of $x$ equal:

First equation multiplied by $14$: $280x + 210y + 182z = 168$
Second equation multiplied by $20$: $280x + 120y + 220z = 480$

Now, subtract the second equation from the first one:

$(280x + 210y + 182z) - (280x + 120y + 220z) = 168 - 480$
$90y - 38z = -312$

Now we need to eliminate $x$ from the first and third equations. Multiply the first equation by $20$ and the third equation by $20$:

First equation multiplied by $20$: $400x + 300y + 260z = 240$
Third equation multiplied by $20$: $-400x + 420y + 80z = 340$

Now, add the two equations:

$(400x + 300y + 260z) + (-400x + 420y + 80z) = 240 + 340$
$720y + 340z = 580$

Now we have two equations with $y$ and $z$:

1. $90y - 38z = -312$
2. $720y + 340z = 580$

Solve the first equation for $y$:

$90y = 312 + 38z$
$y = \frac{312 + 38z}{90}$
$y = \frac{156 + 19z}{45}$

Substitute this expression for $y$ into the second equation:

$720\left(\frac{156 + 19z}{45}\right) + 340z = 580$

Solve for $z$:

$160(156 + 19z) + 340z = 580 \times 45$
$25600 + 3040z + 340z = 26100$
$3380z = 500$
$z = \frac{500}{3380}$
$z = \frac{25}{169}$

Now that we have $z$, we can substitute it back into the expression for $y$:

$y = \frac{156 + 19 \times \frac{25}{169}}{45}$
$y = \frac{156 + \frac{475}{169}}{45}$
$y = \frac{\frac{26244 + 475}{169}}{45}$
$y = \frac{26719}{7605}$
$y = \frac{127}{347}$

$20x + 15\left(\frac{127}{347}\right) + 13\left(\frac{25}{169}\right) = 12$

Solve for $x$:

$20x = 12 - 15\left(\frac{127}{347}\right) - 13\left(\frac{25}{169}\right)$
$20x = 12 - \frac{1905}{347} - \frac{325}{169}$
$20x = 12 - \frac{1905 + 325 \times 2}{347}$
$20x = 12 - \frac{1905 + 650}{347}$
$20x = 12 - \frac{2555}{347}$
$20x = \frac{4164 - 2555}{347}$

$x = \frac{1609}{347 \times 20}$
$x = \frac{1609}{6940}$
$x = \frac{8045}{34700}$

$x = \frac{1609}{6940} = \frac{8045}{34700} = \frac{1}{2.174} \approx \frac{1}{2}$
$y = \frac{127}{347}$
$z = \frac{25}{169}$

$x \approx \frac{1}{2}$, $y = \frac{127}{347}$, $z = \frac{25}{169}$

paragraphs.english: Jia Yun, after hearing the girl's words, felt both convenient and elegant. He was just about to ask for her name, remembering that she was a servant in Madam Yu's quarters, so he didn't press for it. He said, "I should do this, I will come again tomorrow." Then he began to walk out. Baiming offered, "I'll fetch you some tea, Sir. You can have it before you leave." Jia Yun was still walking as he turned his head and said, "No, I have other things to do." While he spoke, his eyes were fixed on the girl, who was still standing there, not having moved.
paragraphs.chinese: 贾芸听了这丫头的话，觉得既简便又俏丽，他正想问她的名字，想到她是宝玉屋里的丫头，不便询问，便说：“我确实应该这样，我明天再来。”说完就往外走。焙茗说：“我去给您倒茶，爷您喝了茶再走。”贾芸边走边回头说：“不用，我还有事呢。”嘴里说着话，眼睛却一直望着那丫头，见她还站在那里没有走。

paragraphs.original: 那贾芸一径回来，至次日，来至大门前，可巧遇见凤姐往那边去请安，才上了车。见贾芸过来，便命人叫住，隔著窗子笑道：“芸儿，你竟有胆子在我跟前弄鬼！怪道你送东西给我，原来你有事求我。昨儿你叔叔才告诉我，说你求他。”贾芸笑道：“求叔叔的事，婶娘别提，我这里正后悔呢。早知这样，我一起头儿就求婶娘，这会子也早完了。谁承望叔叔竟不能的！”凤姐笑道：“哦！你那边没成儿，昨儿又来找我了。”贾芸笑道：“婶娘辜负了我的孝心，我并没有这个意思；要有这个意思，昨儿还不求婶娘吗？如今婶娘既知道了，我倒要把叔叔搁开，少不得求婶娘，好歹疼我一点儿！”凤姐冷笑道：“你们要拣远道儿走么！早告诉我一声儿，多大点子事，还值的耽误到这会子！那园子里还要种树，种花儿，我正想个人呢。早说不早完了？”贾芸笑道：“这样，明日婶娘就派我罢。”凤姐半晌道：“这个我看著不大好，等明年正月里的烟火灯烛那个大宗儿下来再派你，不好？”贾芸道：“好婶娘，先把这个派了我。果然这件办的好，再派我那件罢。”凤姐笑道：“你倒会拉长线儿！－－罢了，要不是你叔叔说，我不管你的事。我不过吃了饭就过来，你到午错时候来领银子，后日就进去种花儿。”说著，命人驾起香车，径去了。
paragraphs.english: Jia Yun returned home, and the next day he went to the main gate, just in time to see Lady Jia Feng heading in the opposite direction to pay her respects to her neighbors. As she was about to enter her carriage, she had one of her attendants stop her and then called out through the window with a smile, "Yun'er, you're finally showing some backbone around me! No wonder you sent me those gifts; you must have something you're hoping to get. Your uncle just told me yesterday that you're asking him for something." Jia Yun replied with a laugh, "I've already regretted asking my uncle. If I had known that, I would have just asked you directly, and it would have been settled already. I never thought my uncle would not agree to it!" Lady Jia Feng laughed and said, "Oh! You didn't manage to get your uncle's approval, so you came to me yesterday, did you?" Jia Yun laughed again, "It's not that I didn't mean to ask you, Aunt. If I had meant to, I would have asked you yesterday. But now that you know, I must put my uncle on the side and come to you. I must at least get some face from you!" Lady Jia Feng laughed coldly, "You're just trying to take the long road! If you had told me earlier, this wouldn't have been a problem. I've been planning to have something done in the garden for a while now, so why not just get it done now?" Jia Yun replied, "That would be perfect, Aunt. If you could just assign me to this task tomorrow." Lady Jia Feng paused for a moment and then said, "I'm not sure if this is the best idea, but since your uncle mentioned it, how about we assign this task to you next month for the firework and lantern shows? What do you think?" Jia Yun replied, "Aunt, please just assign me this task first. If I can do a good job with this, I'll be more than willing to take on the other task." Lady Jia Feng laughed, "You're trying to drag me into a long-term game, aren't you? Alright, I'll assign this task to you. I'll bring the money over after lunch and you can come and collect it tomorrow. After that, you can go into the garden to plant flowers." With that, she called for her carriage to be ready and left.

paragraphs.english: Jia Yun was so elated that he could no longer restrain himself. He went to the Xiaoyang Chamber and inquired about his cousin Yu, only to find that the latter had gone to the Northern Peace Prince’s Palace early in the morning. Jia Yun sat motionless for most of the morning. It was only when he heard that Madam Chong had returned that he went to write the receipt for the order to collect the pair of seals. At the gates of the household, he ordered the guard to announce his name. Caiming came out, took the receipt, went in to check the sum and date, and handed them back to Jia Yun at once. Jia Yun looked at them and found that the sum was two hundred taels of silver, which made him so delighted that he turned around and went to the silver vault to collect the money. He told his mother of this when he got home, and they both rejoiced. In the early morning of the next day, he went to return the money to Ní Er and collected another fifty taels of silver before leaving through the west gate. He went to find a gardener named Fāng Chūn, and purchased trees from him. This is where the story ends.

paragraphs.original: 宝玉一面吃茶，一面仔细打量。那丫头穿著几件半新不旧的衣裳，倒是一头黑鸦鸦的好头发，挽著鬓儿，容长脸面，细挑身材，却十分俏丽甜净。宝玉便笑问道：“你也是我屋里的人么？”那丫头笑应道：“是。”宝玉道：“既是这屋里的，我怎么不认得？”那丫头听说，便冷笑一声道：“爷不认得的也多呢，岂止我一个？从来我又不递茶水，拿东西，眼面前儿的，一件也做不著，那里认得呢？”宝玉道：“你为什么不做眼面前儿的呢？”那丫头道：“这话我也难说。－－只是有句话回二爷：昨日有个什么芸儿来找二爷，我想二爷不得空儿，便叫焙茗回他；今日来了，不想二爷又往北府里去了。”

paragraphs.original: 刚说到这句话，只见秋纹碧痕唏唏哈哈的笑著进来。两个人共提著一桶水，一手撩衣裳，趔趔趄趄，泼泼撒撒的。那丫头便忙迎出去接。秋纹碧痕，一个抱怨你湿了我的衣裳，一个又说你踹了我的鞋。忽见走出一个人来接水，二人看时，不是别人，原来是小红。二人便都诧异，将水放下，忙进来看时，并没别人，只有宝玉，便心中俱不自在。只得且预备下洗澡之物，待宝玉脱了衣裳，二人便带上门出来，走到那边房内，找著小红，问他方才在屋里做什么。小红道：“我何曾在屋里呢？因我的绢子找不著，往后头找去，不想二爷要茶喝，叫姐姐们一个儿也没有，我赶著进去倒了碗茶，姐姐们就来了。”秋纹兜脸啐了一口道：“没脸面的下流东西！正经叫你催水去，你说有事，倒叫我们去，你可抢这个巧宗儿。一里一里的，这不上来了吗？难道我们倒跟不上你么？你也拿镜子照照，配递茶递水不配！”碧痕道：“明儿我说给他们，凡要茶要水拿东西的事，偺们都别动，只叫他去就完了。”秋纹道：“这么说，还不如我们散了，单让他在这屋里呢！”

paragraphs.original: 二人你一句，我一句，正闹著，只见有个老嬷嬷进来传凤姐的话，说：“明日有人带花儿匠来种树，叫你们严紧些。衣裳，裙子，别混晒混晾的。那土山上都拦著围幕，可别混跑。”秋纹便问：“明日不知是谁带进匠人来监工？”那老婆子道：“什么后廊上的芸哥儿。”秋纹碧痕俱不知道，只管混问别的话，那小红心内明白，知是昨日外书房所见的那人了。

paragraphs.english: So this Little Red was of the Lin clan, her nickname "Red Jade." Because her nickname contained the word "jade," which also appeared in the names of Jade Bao and Jade Dai, she was renamed Little Red. Her family had been servants in the mansion for generations, and her father now oversaw the estates under the mansion's management. This Little Red was 14 years old this year and served in the mansion, being assigned to the Yu Hong Pavilion, where things were indeed quiet and elegant. When Lady Destiny, sisters, and Bao Yu and others moved into the Grand View Garden, it so happened that this pavilion was chosen by Bao Yu.
paragraphs.chinese: 原来这小红本姓林，小名叫红玉，因为“玉”字和宝玉、黛玉的名相犯，便改名小红。原来他家世代在府里做仆人，他父亲现在管着府里各处田地的事务。这小红今年十四岁，在府里当差，被派到了怡红院，这里倒也清净雅致。后来命、姊妹和宝玉等人进了大观园居住，偏巧这一所被宝玉挑中了。

paragraphs.original: 这小红虽然是个不谙事体的丫头，因他原有几分容貌，心内便想向上攀高，每每要在宝玉面前现弄现弄。只是宝玉身边一干人都是伶牙俐爪的，那里插的下手去？不想今日才有些消息，又遭秋纹等一场恶话，心内早灰了一半。正没好气，忽然听见老嬷嬷说起贾芸来，不觉心中一动，便闷闷的回房，睡在床上，暗暗思量。翻来覆去，自觉没情没趣的。忽听的窗外低低的叫道：“红儿，你的绢子我拾在这里呢。”小红听了，忙走出来看时，不是别人，正是贾芸。小红不觉粉面含羞，问道：“二爷在那里拾著的？”只见那贾芸笑道：“你过来，我告诉你。”一面说，一面就上来拉他的衣裳。那小红臊的转身一跑，却被门槛子绊倒。
paragraphs.english: "Little Red, though she was ignorant, because of her decent looks, always wanted to climb the ladder higher, and often showed off herself in front of Yu Bai. However, all the people around Yu Bai were clever and shrewd, and she couldn't get a chance to help them. She didn't expect to finally have a chance to show herself, only to be scolded by others like Qiutun. Her heart was not happy, and she was just in a bad mood when she suddenly heard the old nurse mentioning about Jia Yun. She felt a little stirred, so she went back to her room in silence to sleep, lying in bed and thinking to herself. She couldn't fall asleep and felt that it was boring. Suddenly, she heard a voice outside the window, "Little Red, I found your handkerchief here." Little Red hurriedly came out to see, and the person speaking was indeed Jia Yun. Little Red's face turned red with embarrassment, and she asked, "Where did Second Master find it?" Jia Yun smiled and said, "Come here, I'll tell you." As he spoke, he pulled her clothes. Little Red blushed and turned to run away, but she tripped over the门槛 and fell down."
paragraphs.chinese: 这小红虽然不懂事，但因为长得不错，总想往高处攀，时常在宝玉面前显示自己。只是宝玉身边都是伶牙俐爪的人，她插不上手。没想到今天好不容易有机会露面，结果又被秋纹等人说了一顿坏话。她心里很不痛快，正没好气的时候，忽然听到老嬷嬷提起贾芸，心下有些动，于是闷闷地回房睡觉，躺在床上默默地想心事。翻来覆去睡不着，心里觉得没意思。突然，窗外传来一个声音：“红儿，你的丝绢我在这里捡到了。”小红一听，忙走出来一看，说话的人正是贾芸。小红顿时脸红害羞，问道：“二爷是在哪里捡到的？”只见贾芸笑道：“你过来，我告诉你。”一边说，一边拉她的衣服。小红臊得转身就跑，却因为被门槛绊倒了。
